alert.note: Alert for Snohomish (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 05 at 12:24PM PDT until November 05 at 10:00PM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Snohomish River Near Monroe affecting Snohomish County. .Heavy rain over the area came to an end early Saturday morning with no hydrological significant rain forecast over the weekend. The Snohomish River has crested right at flood stage and will continue to recede. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Snohomish River Near Monroe. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, the Snohomish River will cause minor flooding of low pasture lands and several roads near the river. A stage of 15 feet at this location corresponds to Phase 2 in the Snohomish County Flood Warning System. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM PDT Saturday the stage was 14.4 feet. - The river crested at 15 ft earlier this morning. - Forecast...The river has crested at flood stage and will continue to recede. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 830 PM PDT.
